CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 28, 1958, page A11, reads: "Former Pittsburghers had a ball renewing acquaintances at the Alpha Formal at Hotel Webster Hall last Friday night. In the above picture: Mr. and Mrs. Clarence Reese, formerly of this city and now of Cleveland, Ohio, attended the formal with their hosts, Mr. and Mrs. H.D. Primas and Mr. and Mrs. Rufus Dickinson. First row, left to right: Mrs. Primas, Mrs. Reese. Last row: Mr. Primas, Mrs. Dickinson and Mr. Dickinson. In the second photograph: Mrs. Ada Walker Richmond, right, attended the ball with her son and his wife, Capt. and Mrs. William Walker of Tallahassee, Fla.; Miss Mary Lou Gayles of Philadelphia, left, and Mrs. Edith Turner of Columbus, Ohio, right, are shown being escorted into the ballroom by Alpha frater, E. Ralph Conley. Mrs. Turner was the guest of Dr. and Mrs. Max Johnson. - Harris Photo"
TitMainTitle: Two women wearing formal attire and man wearing military uniform, left to right: Mrs. Walker, Captain William Walker, and Ada Walker Richmond, standing on exterior steps of Hotel Webster Hall for the Alpha Phi Alpha 30th Anniversary Ball
